## Functions revisited

Load (i.e. **source**) our rescale() function from last day.

```{r}
source("http://tinyurl.com/rescale-R")
```

Test this function

```{r}
rescale(1:5)
```

```{r}
is.numeric(1:5)
```










```{r}
rescale(c(1:5), "string")
```

```{r}
rescale2(c(1:5, "string"))
```

```{r}
is.numeric("string")
```

```{r}
!is.numeric("string")
```

```{r}
x <- c( 1, 2, NA, 3, NA)
y <- c(NA, 3, NA, 3, 4)
```

```{r}
is.na(x)
is.na(y)

is.na(x) & is.na(y)

sum(is.na(x) & is.na(y))
# which(is.na(x) & is.na(y))
```

Now take our working snippet and make a first function

```{r}
both_na <- function(x,y) {
  # Check for NA elements in both vectors
  sum(is.na(x) & is.na(y))
}
```

```{r}
both_na(x,y)
```

```{r}
x <- c(NA, NA, NA)
y1 <- c( 1, NA, NA)
y2 <- c( 1, NA, NA, NA)
```

```{r}
# What will this return?
both_na(x, y2)
```

```{r}
both_na2(x, y2)
```

```{r}
# Lets define an example x and y
x <- c( 1, 2, NA, 3, NA)
y <- c(NA, 3, NA, 3, 4)
both_na3(x,y)
```
